fields.text: How do you usually get to campus?
How do you use notes/cheat sheets in exams?
How do you deal with paper consumption when studying?
What is your typical lunch during your studies?
How do you handle leftover food in everyday life?
How do you go about buying a laptop, tablet, or smartphone for your studies?
How do you usually obtain the books you need for your study modules?
How do you handle drinks on campus?
Where do you typically spend most of your time studying during exam periods?
How much does your budget influence sustainable decisions in daily life?
How would you assess your own behavior regarding sustainability in daily life?
How do you rate your university’s efforts in sustainability (e.g. cafeteria offerings, building energy efficiency, curriculum, waste separation on campus)?
By bike, e-scooter or on foot
fields.extra: Physical activity in fresh air boosts body and mind and clears your head before or after studying

fields.text: By public transport (e.g. bus, train, tram)
By car sharing or ride-sharing
fields.extra: Car sharing makes your commute more social, entertaining, and mentally stimulating

fields.text: By my own car or motorcycle
fields.improvement: Switching to public transport or car sharing benefits the environment and gives you valuable time to read, study, or relax

fields.text: I don’t use notes/cheatsheets
I only use notes/cheat sheets that I need
I sometimes bring more than necessary
I always bring everything I can, even if unnecessary
fields.improvement: Too many documents can cause confusion and stress during exams, it’s better to focus and bring only what truly helps

fields.text: Exclusively digital
Mostly digital, sometimes paper
Very often paper
paper only
fields.improvement: Learning solely with paper consumes many resources, digital alternatives protect the environment and help with a clearer structure

fields.text: I bring homemade food in a reusable lunchbox (e.g. glass or sturdy plastic)
I bring pre-packaged or ready-made meals (e.g. from a supermarket)
I regularly eat at the cafeteria
I frequently order delivery (e.g. pizza, sushi, fast food)
fields.improvement: Regular food delivery creates a lot of packaging waste and is often more expensive, bringing your own meals saves resources and money

fields.text: I plan my meals so there are hardly any leftovers and rarely throw anything away
I try to use leftovers creatively (e.g. reheat, freeze, repurpose)
Sometimes there are leftovers I can’t use
I often have too much and regularly throw food away
fields.improvement: Frequent food waste harms the environment and your budget, planning and reusing reduces waste and saves money

fields.text: I always buy the latest tech; performance is most important
I try to use devices as long as possible
I buy used devices when possible
I use hand-me-downs from family/friends
fields.improvement: Always buying new tech is resource-intensive, older or second-hand devices are often sufficient and more sustainable

fields.text: I borrow them from other students or friends
I use books from the (university) library
I buy used books (e.g. via platforms or notices)
I buy new books in stores or online
fields.improvement: Buying new books is expensive and resource-heavy, used or borrowed books are often just as effective and more eco-friendly

fields.text: I use my own reusable bottle and refill it regularly (e.g. at water dispensers)
fields.extra: Drinking plenty of water is important for a healthy life and successful learning

fields.text: I buy bottled drinks and reuse the bottles
I buy a new disposable bottle each time
I mainly consume drinks in disposable packaging like cans, to-go cups, or cartons
fields.improvement: Disposable packaging creates a lot of waste, a reusable bottle is more sustainable and saves money in the long run

fields.text: Mainly on campus, e.g. in study rooms or open spaces
In the library or similar quiet public study places
With others – e.g. in study groups or at friends’ places
Alone at home, in my own study space
fields.improvement: Studying alone at home can be efficient, but group learning or using campus study spaces encourages exchange and can improve effectiveness

fields.text: I try to act sustainably even if it sometimes costs more
If it fits well or is reasonably priced, I choose sustainable options
I’d like to live more sustainably, but it’s often too expensive
I prioritize price; sustainability is secondary
I consciously consider sustainability in many areas and strive to improve
I pay attention to some things but not consistently in all areas
Sustainability is important to me, but often hard to implement
I rarely think about it and act more unconsciously
Very good
Average
Poor
No opinion
